was scratching himself so hard that he was leaving red marks and cuts on himself, I sat

was able to return to class after that.

math. Teacher used several prompts to redirect student back to work. A. Lopez began throwing chairs, desk and running
around the classroom. A. Kaylor attempted to hold student however not successful. Student continued to throw
and kick staff. C. Lyons-King placed student in a standing PRT. The hold progressed to a PRT secondary with M. Lederman
assisting with the legs. The hold lasted approx. 10 minutes. The hold was released when student was calm. He quickly got
up and began throwing chairs. C. Lyons-King placed student in a standing PRT for approximately 2 minutes. Student was
given choices. He continued to run around the room and push and kick staff. Student was escorted to ALC. He engaged in
aggression all the way down to ALC. While in ALC, student started to charge staff, climbed the furniture and
aggressive anytime that he was redirected to his area. C. Lyons-King placed student in a standing PRT for approx..
6 minutes. Student went to the bench and timer was set. He attempted to bolt out of the room and this was blocked. He
continued to engage in aggression (hitting, kicking, pushing). M. Vernooy placed student in a standing PRT for approx. 1
minute. He was released and staff attempted to use distraction. Was successful for a period of time. Student attempted to
run and was aggressive towards M. Vernooy. M. Vernooy placed student in a standing PRT for 3 minutes. Plan was
developed with student to return back to class.
See above. Student was seen by school nurse. Principal contacted student mother about the hold.
